channel.title: Buying Portal 2 for PC
channel.description:
Hi guys.
So, here's my problem: for some time, I am trying to buy Portal 2 for PC. For some unknow reason, the game isn't available to PC on physical form (DVD, whatever) here on São Paulo, Brazil. I've tried looking on some big stores, like Kalunga, Nobel and Fnac, but there's only the PS3 version of the game. Do you know where can I buy the game? I don't trust internet financial transactions using credit card, and I don't have much money to spend buying the game on another country and bring it here by postal service.
There are some sites that are selling the original CD key of the game, all with the same price, but I don't know if it's safe to trust them, even if I don't pay with credit card.
Please, any suggestions?
EDIT:I don't have an international credit card.

Some stupid reporter made a big fuzz of “omg haxorz are stealing teh credit cardz!”, and then people get scared.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying Portal 2 for PC
item.dc:creator: TheOneAndOnly
item.description:
HumanParadoxx:

Ok, Steam is secure, but it’s supposed to pay with dollars, which I don’t have. How the transaction would work with reais?

I don’t know if this was answered before - I think not -, but, for me, whenever I buy on Steam, the purchase shows up on the ‘international balance’ bill of my credit card (Visa). Usually, two bills arrive home in the same envelope; one is the national balance, and the other is the international balance. If you leave the purchase there (you can pay it using dollars at your bank the same way you would pay with your own currency), it will automatically be converted into your currency the following month, and you can pay with reais then. You get an extra month to gather the money

A bit confusing I guess, but that’s how it works for me.

Read full topic

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Buying Portal 2 for PC
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I bought the PS3 version. You need to have access to a PS3 to activate it on your Steam account, and it ties your PSN account to your Steam account.

The disc is completely detached from the PC version, and is only needed to activate the key on your Steam account. If you don’t own a PS3 but can use a friend’s for 5 minutes, you will be set.

I got the game when the PSN was down, and played the whole thing without being connected to Steam. Once the PSN came back up, I linked it to my Steam account and it played exactly the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Buying Portal 2 for PC
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Too bad it wouldn’t work, since you have to register the PS3 version to a Steamworks account, and it’s linked to the PC version.

item.description:
Yeah, if you cannot find a physical copy of Portal 2 for PC and you’re unwilling to buy it on Steam, then the PS3 version is your only option. You could also import Portal 2 PC from the US, but that could be a bit pricey.

item.title: Buying Portal 2 for PC
item.dc:creator: HumanParadoxx
item.description:
sersoft:

you don’t trust Steam with your credit card? It’s made by the same people who made Portal 2, or is it your parents who don’t trust online credit card payments?

after you get it on steam you can just burn the gcf files onto a DVDR DL, steam is required to play portal 2 anyway

I don’t use credit card on internet transactions because of risk of hacking.
